channel.title: BBC News - Middle East
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Egypt accused of covering up extrajudicial executions
item.description: Security forces have falsely claimed that suspects are dying in shoot-outs, Human Rights Watch says.

item.title: Six Palestinian prisoners escape Israeli jail through tunnel
item.description: Israel launches a huge manhunt after six militants dig their way out of the high-security jail.

item.title: Nizar Banat: Palestinian officers charged over activist's death
item.description: Nizar Banat died shortly after being beaten in June, triggering an unprecedented wave of protests.

item.title: Twins conjoined at head separated after rare surgery in Israel
item.description: The one-year-old girls are said to be recovering well after the 12-hour operation in Israel.

item.title: Yemen war: Saudis intercept Houthi missiles - defence ministry
item.description: Two children are injured by shrapnel, Riyadh says, in an attack the Houthis say targeted Saudi oil.

item.title: Hamid Nouri: How Sweden arrested a suspected Iranian war criminal
item.description: Prosecutors have put Hamid Nouri on trial over a 1988 massacre in Iran. This is how they did it.

item.title: Covid: What Israel tells us about the way out of the pandemic
item.description: Third jabs given as part of a booster programme are beginning to dampen the latest Covid surge.

item.title: Islamic State 'Beatle' Alexanda Kotey pleads guilty over US hostage deaths
item.description: Alexanda Kotey is facing life in prison over the murders of US journalists and relief workers.

item.title: Cyprus on alert as Syrian oil slick spreads across Mediterranean
item.description: Modelling suggests fuel that leaked from a power plant last week will soon reach northern Cyprus.

item.title: Nizar Banat: The death shaking the Palestinian leadership
item.description: The killing of Nizar Banat in Palestinian custody has fuelled rare protests calling for change.

item.title: Afghanistan: Qatar and Turkey become Taliban's lifeline to the outside world
item.description: Qatar and Turkey emerge as key channels between Afghanistan's new rulers and the outside world.

item.title: Gulf Sky: 'Our ship was hijacked and taken to Iran'
item.description: Former crew of the oil tanker Gulf Sky talk publically for the first time about the ship's disappearance.

item.title: How latte art led to a job from hell in Oman
item.description: A South African barista was offered a dream opportunity in Oman but unknowingly signed away his freedoms.

item.title: The murderous crime wave sweeping Israel's Arabs
item.description: Many killings often go unsolved, with blame being put on the police.

item.title: Tunisia crisis: Democrats, despots and the fight for power
item.description: Tunisia is in turmoil since the president suspended parliament and increased his own power.

item.title: West faces dilemmas over tanker attack
item.description: A drone attack on a ship off the coast of Oman has worsened already strained ties with Iran.

item.title: Iran water: What's causing the shortages?
item.description: Iranian officials have warned of historic drought while experts blame years of poor water management.

item.title: Why Palestinians are protesting against their own government
item.description: Protests against the Palestinian Authority erupted after a popular activist died in custody.

item.title: Israeli conjoined twins see each other for first time after surgery
item.description: The Israeli twin girls were joined at the head but have been separated after a rare operation.

item.title: Iran prison abuse exposed by hackers' CCTV leak
item.description: Security footage released by hackers shows mistreatment inside Iran's notorious Evin prison.

item.title: Why is Israel demolishing homes in East Jerusalem?
item.description: Israel says the homes were built without planning permission and it is to try to keep East Jerusalem in order.

item.title: Beirut blast: ‘The day our city exploded’
item.description: One year on from the blast that rocked Beirut, no one has yet been made accountable.
